channel.title: NPR Topics: News
channel.description: NPR news, audio, and podcasts. Coverage of breaking stories, national and world news, politics, business, science, technology, and extended coverage of major national and world events.
channel.copyright: Copyright 2024 NPR - For Personal Use Only

item.title: Biden to announce new Chinese tariffs; Michael Cohen returns to the stand
item.description: President Biden will announce tariffs on $18 million of Chinese imports. Trump's lawyers will cross-examine Michael Cohen today in the former president's hush money trial.
item.content:encoded:
President Biden will announce tariffs on $18 million of Chinese imports. Trump's lawyers will cross-examine Michael Cohen today in the former president's hush money trial.

(Image credit: Scott Olson)
item.dc:creator: Suzanne Nuyen

item.title: It was a classic rap beef. Then Drake revived Tupac with AI and Congress got involved
item.description: AI can conjure the voice or likeness of a dead celebrity with just a few clicks. This opens a host of legal questions about the rights of the deceased and their heirs to control their digital replicas
item.content:encoded:
AI can conjure the voice or likeness of a dead celebrity with just a few clicks. This opens a host of legal questions about the rights of the deceased and their heirs to control their digital replicas

(Image credit: Prince Williams)
item.dc:creator: Greg Rosalsky

item.title: What are 'the kids' thinking these days? Honor Levy aims to tell in 'My First Book'
item.description: Social media discourse and the inevitable backlash aside, the 26-year-old writer's first book is an amusing, if uneven, take on growing up white, privileged, and Gen Z.
item.content:encoded: Social media discourse and the inevitable backlash aside, the 26-year-old writer's first book is an amusing, if uneven, take on growing up white, privileged, and Gen Z.
item.dc:creator: Leland Cheuk

item.title: Anti-war protests, a Chicago DNC: Is it 1968 all over again? Some historians say no
item.description: There are clear similarities between 1968 and 2024, from presidential elections and anti-war protests to new Planet of the Apes movies. But historians tell NPR there are some key differences too.
item.content:encoded: There are clear similarities between 1968 and 2024, from presidential elections and anti-war protests to new Planet of the Apes movies. But historians tell NPR there are some key differences too.
item.dc:creator: Rachel Treisman

item.title: Biden announces new tariffs on imports of Chinese goods, including electric vehicles
item.description: President Biden is keeping the tariffs on Chinese imports put in place by his predecessor and 2024 opponent, former President Donald Trump. And he's adding new ones for things like electric vehicles.
item.content:encoded:
President Biden is keeping the tariffs on Chinese imports put in place by his predecessor and 2024 opponent, former President Donald Trump. And he's adding new ones for things like electric vehicles.

(Image credit: Scott Olson)
item.dc:creator: Asma Khalid

item.title: AI-generated spam is starting to fill social media. Here's why
item.description: A Jesus made of vegetables, bizarre log cabins, products that don't exist. AI-generated images are creating new forms of clickbait and causing some users to doubt what's real.
item.content:encoded: A Jesus made of vegetables, bizarre log cabins, products that don't exist. AI-generated images are creating new forms of clickbait and causing some users to doubt what's real.
item.dc:creator: Shannon Bond

item.title: FAA bill would force the agency to craft 'real world' rules for airplane evacuations
item.description: Federal regulators say all airline passengers must be able to evacuate a plane within 90 seconds. The FAA reauthorization bill would require the agency to reconsider its testing standards.
item.content:encoded:
Federal regulators say all airline passengers must be able to evacuate a plane within 90 seconds. The FAA reauthorization bill would require the agency to reconsider its testing standards.

(Image credit: STR)
item.dc:creator: Joel Rose

item.title: He invented a successful medical device as a student. Here's his advice for new grads
item.description: When Thorsten Siess was in graduate school, he came up with the idea for a heart device that's now been used in hundreds of thousands of patients around the world.
item.content:encoded: When Thorsten Siess was in graduate school, he came up with the idea for a heart device that's now been used in hundreds of thousands of patients around the world.
item.dc:creator: Sydney Lupkin

item.title: Billboard collapses onto people in Mumbai, killing at least 14
item.description: A rescue operation was ongoing Tuesday, and it was unclear how many people may still be trapped from the collapse during heavy rain and thunderstorms.
item.content:encoded: A rescue operation was ongoing Tuesday, and it was unclear how many people may still be trapped from the collapse during heavy rain and thunderstorms.
item.dc:creator: The Associated Press

item.title: Blinken visits Ukraine to tout U.S. support for Kyiv's fight against Russia
item.description: On his fourth trip to Kyiv since Russia invaded Ukraine in February 2022, Blinken will reaffirm the Biden administration's commitment to Ukraine's defense and long-term security, U.S. officials said.
item.content:encoded: On his fourth trip to Kyiv since Russia invaded Ukraine in February 2022, Blinken will reaffirm the Biden administration's commitment to Ukraine's defense and long-term security, U.S. officials said.
item.dc:creator: The Associated Press
